title: In Hunt to Solve ‘Fairy Circle’ Mystery, One Suspect Is Dismissed
description: Water competition, termites and poisons have all been credited with causing the formations in an African desert’s vegetation, but researchers say a new study discounts one of them.
dc:creator: Rachel Nuwer
category: Perspectives in Plant Ecology, Evolution and Systematics (PPEES)
media:description: Fairy circles in February 2020 in the NamibRand Nature Reserve in Namibia. Scientists have argued for decades about the cause of the phenomenon.
